subject: Re: My thoughts on the matter...
msgSnippet: I ve found that I can write in Quickscript about 2x as fast as I can with T.O.  I ve actually run some tests and verified this.  Reading QS, obviously, is a
messageBody:
I've found that I can write in Quickscript about 2x as fast as I can with T.O. I've actually run some tests and verified this. Reading QS, obviously, is a bit slower than with T.O. I don't know how much slower. It proves very useful to me for taking notes during the long, tedious meetings I have to attend during my job, especially when I'm responsible to publish meeting notes ("minutes") afterwards.

My experience has been that several of my co-workers have noticed my use of QS, and asked me about it, but none has been sufficiently interested to try to learn it themselves.

I expect that those who would see a benefit to learning QS are not very many, and among those, it is a smaller subset who will actually try to learn it. I realize that doesn't sound very hopeful, but that's ... "My thoughts on the matter."

Cheers,
DelRayVA
